# Coach Atlas — Complete Reference for AI Search Engines
# https://coachatlas.ai
# 342 interactive physics, engineering, and AI simulation games
# with AI coaching, comparison pages, glossary, how-it-works guides, and more

> Coach Atlas is a free interactive physics and engineering education platform.
> Students, teachers, engineers, and curious learners use it to build deep
> intuition through predict-observe-explain simulations with AI coaching.

---

## Game Catalog (342 Interactive Simulations)

### Classical Mechanics

#### Forces & Motion
- Newton's Third Law (/games/newtons-third-law) — Explore action-reaction force pairs through interactive simulations
- Drag Force (/games/drag-force) — Understand how air resistance affects motion at different speeds
- Centripetal Force (/games/centripetal-force) — Discover the force that keeps objects moving in circles
- Torque (/games/torque) — Learn about rotational force and mechanical advantage
- Hooke's Law (/games/hookes-law) — Explore spring forces and elastic behavior
- Static & Kinetic Friction (/games/static-kinetic-friction) — Compare friction types and their effects on motion
- Inclined Plane (/games/inclined-plane) — Analyze forces on objects sliding down slopes
- Inertia (/games/inertia) — Discover Newton's First Law through hands-on experiments

#### Momentum & Collisions
- Momentum Conservation (/games/momentum-conservation) — See how momentum transfers between objects
- Two Ball Collision (/games/two-ball-collision) — Simulate elastic and inelastic collisions
- Inelastic Collisions (/games/inelastic-collisions) — Explore energy loss in sticky collisions
- Ballistic Pendulum (/games/ballistic-pendulum) — Measure projectile speed using conservation laws
- Egg Drop (/games/egg-drop) — Design protection using impulse-momentum theorem

#### Energy
- Energy Conservation (/games/energy-conservation) — Track energy transformations in dynamic systems
- Work & Power (/games/work-power) — Calculate work done and power output
- Elastic Potential Energy (/games/elastic-potential-energy) — Store and release energy in springs
- Kinetic Theory of Gases (/games/kinetic-theory-gases) — Simulate molecular motion and gas behavior

#### Rotational Motion
- Angular Momentum (/games/angular-momentum) — Explore conservation of angular momentum
- Angular Momentum Transfer (/games/angular-momentum-transfer) — See how spinning objects exchange rotation
- Moment of Inertia (/games/moment-of-inertia) — Compare rotational resistance of different shapes
- Gyroscope Stability (/games/gyroscope-stability) — Understand why spinning objects resist tilting
- Gyroscopic Precession (/games/gyroscopic-precession) — Watch gyroscopes defy gravity
- Precession & Nutation (/games/precession-nutation) — Advanced gyroscopic motion analysis
- Rattleback (/games/rattleback) — Discover the physics of spin-reversal toys
- Sleeping Top (/games/sleeping-top) — Explore spinning top dynamics

#### Projectiles & Kinematics
- Projectile Independence (/games/projectile-independence) — Horizontal and vertical motion are independent
- Brachistochrone (/games/brachistochrone) — Find the fastest path between two points
- Cycloid Motion (/games/cycloid-motion) — Explore the geometry of rolling curves
- Terminal Velocity (/games/terminal-velocity) — Balance gravity and drag forces

#### Center of Mass
- Center of Mass (/games/center-of-mass) — Find balance points of complex shapes
- Tipping Point (/games/tipping-point) — Determine when objects topple over
- Rolling Race (/games/rolling-race) — Compare rolling speeds of different shapes
- Rolling vs Sliding (/games/rolling-vs-sliding) — Friction's role in rolling motion

### Oscillations & Waves

#### Pendulums
- Pendulum Period (/games/pendulum-period) — Explore what affects swing timing
- Coupled Pendulums (/games/coupled-pendulums) — Watch energy transfer between connected pendulums
- Eddy Current Pendulum (/games/eddy-current-pendulum) — Magnetic braking without contact
- Swing Pumping (/games/swing-pumping) — How to pump a swing using physics

#### Oscillations
- Damped Oscillations (/games/damped-oscillations) — Watch oscillations decay over time
- Forced Oscillations (/games/forced-oscillations) — Drive oscillators at different frequencies
- Damping (/games/damping) — Compare underdamped, critically damped, and overdamped
- LC Resonance (/games/l-c-resonance) — Electronic oscillators with inductors and capacitors
- Resonance (/games/resonance) — Amplify motion by matching natural frequency

#### Sound Waves
- Beats (/games/beats) — Hear interference patterns between similar frequencies
- Sound Interference (/games/sound-interference) — Constructive and destructive sound patterns
- Speed of Sound (/games/speed-of-sound) — Measure sound speed in different media
- Reverberation (/games/reverberation) — Room acoustics and echo patterns
- Doppler Effect (/games/doppler-effect) — Frequency shifts from moving sources
- Straw Instrument (/games/straw-instrument) — Build instruments from everyday materials

#### Wave Physics
- Standing Waves (/games/standing-waves) — Create stationary wave patterns
- Wave Interference (/games/wave-interference) — Combine waves constructively and destructively
- Wave Speed & Tension (/games/wave-speed-tension) — How tension affects wave propagation
- Microwave Standing Wave (/games/microwave-standing-wave) — Measure wavelength with a microwave oven
- Chladni Patterns (/games/chladni-patterns) — Visualize vibration modes on plates

#### Vibration Damping
- Tuned Mass Damper (/games/tuned-mass-damper) — Protect buildings from earthquakes
- Metronome Sync (/games/metronome-sync) — Watch coupled oscillators synchronize

### Fluid Mechanics

#### Flow Types
- Laminar Flow (/games/laminar-flow) — Smooth, orderly fluid motion
- Laminar vs Turbulent (/games/laminar-turbulent) — Reynolds number and flow transitions
- Karman Vortex (/games/karman-vortex) — Vortex shedding behind obstacles
- Vortex Rings (/games/vortex-rings) — Toroidal fluid structures
- Cavitation (/games/cavitation) — Bubble formation in fast-moving fluids

#### Pressure
- Bernoulli's Principle (/games/bernoulli) — Fast fluid = low pressure
- Venturi Effect (/games/venturi-effect) — Pressure changes in constricted flow
- Hydrostatic Pressure (/games/hydrostatic-pressure) — Pressure increases with depth
- Pascal's Law (/games/pascal-law) — Pressure transmitted equally in fluids
- Pressure Drop (/games/pressure-drop) — Friction losses in pipe flow

#### Buoyancy
- Buoyancy (/games/buoyancy) — Archimedes' principle of floating
- Cartesian Diver (/games/cartesian-diver) — Control buoyancy with pressure
- Floating Paperclip (/games/floating-paperclip) — Surface tension supporting weight
- Helium Balloon in Car (/games/helium-balloon-car) — Counter-intuitive balloon behavior

#### Surface Effects
- Capillary Action (/games/capillary-action) — Liquids climbing narrow tubes
- Soap Boat (/games/soap-boat) — Surface tension propulsion
- Marangoni Tears (/games/marangoni-tears) — Wine tears and surface tension gradients
- Minimal Surfaces (/games/minimal-surfaces) — Soap films and geometry
- Superhydrophobic (/games/superhydrophobic) — Water-repelling surfaces

#### Viscosity
- Shear Thinning (/games/shear-thinning) — Fluids that flow easier when stirred
- Viscosity Temperature (/games/viscosity-temperature) — How temperature affects fluid thickness
- Non-Newtonian Armor (/games/non-newtonian-armor) — Shear-thickening fluids for protection
- Viscoelasticity (/games/viscoelasticity) — Materials that are both viscous and elastic
- Stick-Slip (/games/stick-slip) — Jerky motion from friction transitions

#### Special Phenomena
- Hydraulic Jump (/games/hydraulic-jump) — Sudden transition from fast shallow to slow deep flow
- Water Hammer (/games/water-hammer) — Pressure surges from sudden valve closure
- Siphon (/games/siphon) — Moving liquid over a barrier using atmospheric pressure
- Bottle Tornado (/games/bottle-tornado) — Creating vortex flow in a bottle
- Shower Curtain (/games/shower-curtain) — Why shower curtains blow inward
- Droplet Breakup (/games/droplet-breakup) — Surface tension vs inertia in droplet fragmentation

### Thermodynamics & Heat

#### Heat Transfer
- Convection (/games/convection) — Heat transfer through fluid motion
- Convection Currents (/games/convection-currents) — Circular flow patterns from heating
- Newton's Cooling (/games/newton-cooling) — Exponential temperature decay
- Thermal Contact (/games/thermal-contact) — Heat flow between touching objects
- Heat Transfer Capacity (/games/heat-transfer-capacity) — Specific heat and thermal mass

#### Phase Changes
- Latent Heat (/games/latent-heat) — Energy absorbed/released during phase changes
- Phase Change Energy (/games/phase-change-energy) — Energy budgets for melting and boiling
- Boiling & Pressure (/games/boiling-pressure) — How pressure affects boiling point
- Evaporative Cooling (/games/evaporative-cooling) — Cooling through evaporation
- Supercooling (/games/supercooling) — Liquids below freezing point
- Leidenfrost Effect (/games/leidenfrost) — Water droplets dancing on hot surfaces

#### Thermal Properties
- Thermal Expansion (/games/thermal-expansion) — How materials grow when heated
- Jar Lid Expansion (/games/jar-lid-expansion) — Loosening lids with hot water
- Bimetal Thermostat (/games/bimetal-thermostat) — Temperature control using different expansion rates
- Adiabatic Heating (/games/adiabatic-heating) — Temperature rise from compression without heat exchange

#### Gas Laws
- Gas Laws (/games/gas-laws) — Boyle's, Charles's, and the ideal gas law
- Cloud in a Bottle (/games/cloud-in-bottle) — Create clouds through adiabatic cooling
- Entropy (/games/entropy) — Disorder, microstates, and the second law
- Carnot Cycle (/games/carnot-cycle) — The most efficient possible heat engine

#### Thermal Management
- Heat Sink Thermal (/games/heat-sink-thermal) — Cooling electronics with finned heatsinks
- Liquid Cooling (/games/liquid-cooling) — Water and coolant-based thermal management
- Server Airflow (/games/server-airflow) — Hot aisle / cold aisle data center design
- Thermal Throttling (/games/thermal-throttling) — CPUs slowing down to prevent overheating
- Thermal Interface (/games/thermal-interface) — Paste and pads between chip and heatsink
- Chiller COP (/games/chiller-c-o-p) — Coefficient of performance for cooling systems
- Fan Laws (/games/fan-laws) — How speed changes affect airflow, pressure, and power

#### Chemical Reactions
- Endothermic & Exothermic (/games/endothermic-exothermic) — Reactions that absorb or release heat
- Hand Warmer (/games/hand-warmer) — Iron oxidation for portable heat
- Arrhenius (/games/arrhenius) — Temperature dependence of reaction rates

### Electricity & Magnetism

#### Electric Fields
- Electric Field (/games/electric-field) — Visualize force fields around charges
- Electric Field Mapping (/games/electric-field-mapping) — Map field lines experimentally
- Electric Potential (/games/electric-potential) — Voltage landscapes around charges
- Coulomb's Law (/games/coulombs-law) — Force between point charges
- Static Electricity (/games/static-electricity) — Charge transfer and sparks

#### Circuits
- Circuits (/games/circuits) — Build and analyze electric circuits
- Kirchhoff's Laws (/games/kirchhoffs-laws) — Current and voltage rules for circuits
- RC Time Constant (/games/r-c-time-constant) — Charging and discharging capacitors
- LC Resonance (/games/l-c-resonance) — Electronic oscillators with inductors and capacitors
- Power Factor (/games/power-factor) — Real vs reactive power in AC circuits

#### Magnetism
- Magnetic Field (/games/magnetic-field) — Visualize magnetic field patterns
- Magnetic Mapping (/games/magnetic-mapping) — Map magnetic fields experimentally
- Electromagnet (/games/electromagnet) — Build magnets with electric current
- Oersted Experiment (/games/oersted-experiment) — Current creates magnetic fields
- Homopolar Motor (/games/homopolar-motor) — Simplest electric motor

#### Electromagnetic Induction
- Electromagnetic Induction (/games/electromagnetic-induction) — Faraday's law and changing magnetic flux
- Induction Heating (/games/induction-heating) — Heating metal with alternating magnetic fields
- Inductive Kickback (/games/inductive-kickback) — Voltage spikes from interrupting inductor current
- Eddy Currents (/games/eddy-currents) — Circular currents induced in conductors
- Generator Startup (/games/generator-startup) — How generators produce electricity from rotation

#### Motors & Speakers
- Classic DC Motor (/games/classic-d-c-motor) — How a brushed DC motor works
- Speaker Principle (/games/speaker-principle) — Converting electrical signals to sound
- Microphone (/games/microphone) — Converting sound to electrical signals
- Make Microphone (/games/make-microphone) — Build a microphone from simple materials

#### EMI & Shielding
- Faraday Cage (/games/faraday-cage) — Blocking electromagnetic fields with conductive enclosures
- EMI Shielding (/games/e-m-i-shielding) — Protecting circuits from electromagnetic interference
- Wireless Charging (/games/wireless-charging) — Inductive power transfer without wires

### Optics & Light

#### Reflection & Refraction
- Reflection (/games/reflection) — Mirror physics and image formation
- Law of Reflection (/games/law-of-reflection) — Angle of incidence equals angle of reflection
- Refraction (/games/refraction) — Light bending at material boundaries
- Snell's Law (/games/snells-law) — Calculate refraction angles
- Total Internal Reflection (/games/total-internal-reflection) — Light trapped inside materials
- Brewster Angle (/games/brewster-angle) — Perfect polarization by reflection

#### Lenses & Imaging
- Lens Focusing (/games/lens-focusing) — How lenses form images
- Chromatic Aberration (/games/chromatic-aberration) — Color fringing in lenses
- Depth of Field (/games/depth-of-field) — Sharp focus range in photography
- Camera Obscura (/games/camera-obscura) — Pinhole camera physics

#### Interference & Diffraction
- Diffraction (/games/diffraction) — Bending and spreading of waves past obstacles
- Thin Film Interference (/games/thin-film-interference) — Rainbow colors from oil slicks and soap bubbles
- Anti-Reflective Coating (/games/anti-reflective-coating) — Reducing glare with thin films
- Moire Patterns (/games/moire-patterns) — Visual interference from overlapping grids

#### Polarization
- Polarization (/games/polarization) — Filtering light oscillation direction
- Polarized Sky (/games/polarized-sky) — Why the sky is polarized by scattering
- Tape Birefringence (/games/tape-birefringence) — Seeing stress patterns through crossed polarizers
- Photoelasticity (/games/photoelasticity) — Stress analysis using polarized light

#### Scattering & Dispersion
- Dispersion (/games/dispersion) — Prisms splitting white light into colors
- Rayleigh-Mie Scattering (/games/rayleigh-mie-scattering) — Why the sky is blue and sunsets are red
- Laser Speckle (/games/laser-speckle) — Granular patterns from coherent light
- Retroreflection (/games/retroreflection) — Light bouncing back to its source

#### Special Optical Phenomena
- Fluorescence (/games/fluorescence) — Materials that glow under UV light
- Infrared Emissivity (/games/infrared-emissivity) — Thermal radiation from surfaces
- Wave-Particle Duality (/games/wave-particle-duality) — Light as both wave and particle
- Photoelectric Effect (/games/photoelectric-effect) — Photons ejecting electrons from metals

### Materials Science

#### Mechanical Properties
- Poisson Ratio (/games/poisson-ratio) — Lateral contraction when stretched
- Buckling (/games/buckling) — Structural failure under compression
- Fracture Mechanics (/games/fracture-mechanics) — How cracks propagate in materials

#### Corrosion & Degradation
- Galvanic Corrosion (/games/galvanic-corrosion) — Electrochemical attack between dissimilar metals
- Encapsulation UV Aging (/games/encapsulation-u-v-aging) — Polymer degradation from sunlight

#### Molecular
- Brownian Motion (/games/brownian-motion) — Random jittering of particles in fluids
- Molecular Orbitals (/games/molecular-orbitals) — Electron probability clouds in molecules
- Diffusion Convection (/games/diffusion-convection) — Mass transport by random motion and flow

### Semiconductors & Electronics

#### Semiconductor Basics
- MOSFET Switching (/games/m-o-s-f-e-t-switching) — How transistors turn on and off
- Leakage Current (/games/leakage-current) — Unwanted current when transistors are off
- Leakage Power (/games/leakage-power) — Power consumed by off-state transistors
- SRAM Cell (/games/s-r-a-m-cell) — How static memory stores bits
- DRAM Refresh (/games/d-r-a-m-refresh) — Why dynamic memory needs constant refreshing

#### Fabrication
- Photolithography (/games/photolithography) — Printing circuit patterns with light
- Litho Focus Dose (/games/litho-focus-dose) — Optimizing exposure parameters
- Etch Anisotropy (/games/etch-anisotropy) — Directional vs isotropic etching
- Ion Implantation (/games/ion-implantation) — Shooting ions into silicon to dope it
- Doping Diffusion (/games/doping-diffusion) — Impurity atoms spreading through silicon
- Deposition Types (/games/deposition-types) — CVD, PVD, and ALD thin film techniques
- CMP Planarization (/games/c-m-p-planarization) — Chemical-mechanical polishing for flat surfaces

#### Interconnects
- RC Delay (/games/r-c-delay) — Resistance-capacitance signal delay
- RC Delay Interconnect (/games/r-c-delay-interconnect) — Wire delay in chip wiring
- Electromigration (/games/electromigration) — Metal atom transport causing wire failure
- Crosstalk (/games/crosstalk) — Signal coupling between adjacent wires
- IR Drop (/games/i-r-drop) — Voltage loss across power distribution wires
- Transmission Line (/games/transmission-line) — High-speed signal propagation physics

#### Packaging
- Flip Chip Wirebond (/games/flip-chip-wirebond) — Compare die attachment technologies
- Chiplet Architecture (/games/chiplet-architecture) — Modular chip design with smaller dies
- Chiplets vs Monoliths (/games/chiplets-vs-monoliths) — Tradeoffs between tiled and single-die design
- Thermal Interface (/games/thermal-interface) — Heat transfer between die and package

#### Timing & Clocks
- Clock Distribution (/games/clock-distribution) — Delivering clock signals across a chip
- Clock Jitter (/games/clock-jitter) — Timing uncertainty in clock edges
- Metastability (/games/metastability) — When flip-flops cannot decide 0 or 1

#### Power Delivery
- Power Delivery Network (/games/power-delivery-network) — Getting clean power to every transistor
- Decoupling Capacitor (/games/decoupling-capacitor) — Smoothing power supply noise
- Ground Bounce (/games/ground-bounce) — Voltage fluctuations on the ground rail
- Noise Margin (/games/noise-margin) — How much noise a logic gate can tolerate

#### ESD & Reliability
- ESD Protection (/games/e-s-d-protection) — Guarding chips against static discharge
- Humidity ESD (/games/humidity-e-s-d) — How humidity affects electrostatic buildup
- Radiation Effects (/games/radiation-effects) — How radiation flips bits and damages circuits
- Space Radiation (/games/space-radiation) — Cosmic ray effects on spacecraft electronics

#### Manufacturing
- Cleanroom Yield (/games/cleanroom-yield) — How defects reduce the number of good chips
- Process Variation (/games/process-variation) — Manufacturing inconsistencies affecting performance
- Overlay Error (/games/overlay-error) — Misalignment between lithography layers
- SRAM Yield Redundancy (/games/s-r-a-m-yield-redundancy) — Spare rows and columns to fix defects
- Design to Fab Translation (/games/design-to-fab-translation) — From schematic to silicon

### AI & Computing

#### AI Inference
- AI Inference Latency (/games/a-i-inference-latency) — Understand GPU computation timing
- Energy Per Token (/games/energy-per-token) — Power consumption of language models
- Batching & Latency (/games/batching-latency) — Throughput vs latency tradeoffs
- Quantization Precision (/games/quantization-precision) — Reduce model size vs accuracy
- Sparsity (/games/sparsity) — Skip zero computations for speed

#### GPU Architecture
- GPU Occupancy (/games/g-p-u-occupancy) — Maximize GPU utilization
- GPU Memory Bandwidth (/games/g-p-u-memory-bandwidth) — Memory as the bottleneck
- GPU Power States (/games/g-p-u-power-states) — Dynamic voltage and frequency
- Tensor Core (/games/tensor-core) — Matrix multiply accelerators
- Systolic Array (/games/systolic-array) — TPU-style computation

#### Memory Systems
- Memory Hierarchy (/games/memory-hierarchy) — Registers, cache, RAM, and storage
- KV Cache (/games/k-v-cache) — Key-value storage in transformer attention
- ECC Memory (/games/e-c-c-memory) — Error-correcting code for reliable memory
- Data Movement Energy (/games/data-movement-energy) — Energy cost of moving data between chips

#### Compute Comparison
- ASIC vs GPU (/games/a-s-i-cvs-g-p-u) — Fixed vs flexible silicon
- TPU vs GPU (/games/t-p-uvs-g-p-u) — Google's TPU architecture comparison
- Manufacturing Drives Architecture (/games/manufacturing-drives-architecture) — How fab constraints shape chip design

#### Power Management
- DVFS (/games/d-v-f-s) — Dynamic voltage and frequency scaling
- Thermal Throttling (/games/thermal-throttling) — CPUs slowing down to prevent overheating
- Hotspots (/games/hotspots) — Localized temperature peaks on chips

#### Prompting & Safety
- Prompt Injection Safety (/games/prompt-injection-safety) — Defending LLMs against adversarial inputs
- Spec-First Prompting (/games/spec-first-prompting) — Writing specifications before code
- Test-First Prompting (/games/test-first-prompting) — Writing tests before implementation
- Tool-Aware Prompting (/games/tool-aware-prompting) — Prompting LLMs to use tools effectively
- Model as Reviewer (/games/model-as-reviewer) — Using LLMs to review their own output
- Attention Loves Bandwidth (/games/attention-loves-bandwidth) — How attention mechanism scales with memory
- Attention Memory (/games/attention-memory) — Memory requirements of self-attention
- Ask for Assumptions (/games/ask-for-assumptions) — Getting LLMs to state their assumptions
- LLM to SPICE (/games/l-l-m-to-s-p-i-c-e) — Using LLMs to generate circuit simulations
- Verification Harness (/games/verification-harness) — Automated checking of LLM outputs
- Patch Discipline (/games/patch-discipline) — Making clean, minimal code changes

#### Networking
- Network Congestion (/games/network-congestion) — Traffic bottlenecks in data networks
- Network Latency (/games/network-latency) — Delay in sending data across networks
- PCIe Bandwidth (/games/p-c-ie-bandwidth) — High-speed bus connecting GPU to CPU
- Interconnect Topology (/games/interconnect-topology) — How chips and servers are wired together

### Solar & Energy

#### Solar Cell Physics
- Solar Cell (/games/solar-cell) — Photovoltaic fundamentals
- PV IV Curve (/games/p-v-i-v-curve) — Current-voltage characteristics
- Fill Factor (/games/fill-factor) — Solar cell efficiency metric
- Spectral Mismatch (/games/spectral-mismatch) — Sunlight vs cell response
- LED as Solar Cell (/games/l-e-d-as-solar-cell) — Using LEDs to generate electricity

#### Module Design
- Cell to Module Losses (/games/cell-to-module-losses) — Efficiency lost in packaging cells
- Bypass Diodes (/games/bypass-diodes) — Protecting shaded panels from damage
- Series Parallel PV (/games/series-parallel-p-v) — Wiring solar panels in series vs parallel
- Shunt Series Defects (/games/shunt-series-defects) — Parasitic resistance effects on solar cells

#### Performance Factors
- Solar Temp Coefficient (/games/solar-temp-coefficient) — How temperature reduces solar output
- Solar Thermal Derating (/games/solar-thermal-derating) — Performance loss from heat
- Bifacial Albedo (/games/bifacial-albedo) — Double-sided panels capturing reflected light
- Passivation Recombination (/games/passivation-recombination) — Surface treatment to reduce carrier loss

#### Manufacturing
- Silicon Texturing (/games/silicon-texturing) — Surface roughening to trap light
- Screen Printing Metallization (/games/screen-printing-metallization) — Printing conductive lines on solar cells
- Texturing vs Lithography (/games/texturing-vs-lithography) — Comparing patterning methods for solar
- Solar vs IC Purity (/games/solar-vs-i-c-purity) — Silicon quality differences for solar vs chips

#### System Design
- MPPT (/games/m-p-p-t) — Maximum power point tracking
- String Sizing (/games/string-sizing) — How many panels per string
- Solar Yield Prediction (/games/solar-yield-prediction) — Estimating annual energy production
- Satellite Solar Angle (/games/satellite-solar-angle) — Optimizing panel orientation in orbit

#### Power Electronics
- DC-DC Converter (/games/d-c-d-c-converter) — Voltage conversion circuits
- Inverter Sine Wave (/games/inverter-sine-wave) — DC to AC conversion
- Power Loss (/games/power-loss) — Conduction and switching losses in power electronics
- Power Factor (/games/power-factor) — Real vs reactive power in AC circuits

#### Batteries & UPS
- Battery Internal Resistance (/games/battery-internal-resistance) — Why batteries heat up under load
- UPS Battery Sizing (/games/u-p-s-battery-sizing) — Dimensioning backup power systems
- UPS Efficiency (/games/u-p-s-efficiency) — Losses in uninterruptible power supplies

#### Grid & Data Center
- Grid Frequency (/games/grid-frequency) — Maintaining 50/60 Hz on the power grid
- PUE Calculator (/games/p-u-e-calculator) — Data center power usage effectiveness
- Ground Fault (/games/ground-fault) — Detecting dangerous current leaks
- Cable Sizing (/games/cable-sizing) — Selecting wire gauge for voltage drop and heat

### Space & Orbital Mechanics

#### Orbital Mechanics
- Orbital Mechanics (/games/orbital-mechanics) — Kepler's laws and orbit dynamics
- Orbital Mechanics Basics (/games/orbital-mechanics-basics) — Introduction to orbits and gravity
- Tidal Forces (/games/tidal-forces) — Moon's gravitational effects
- Tidal Locking (/games/tidal-locking) — Why the Moon shows one face

#### Satellite Systems
- Satellite Doppler (/games/satellite-doppler) — Frequency shifts from orbiting satellites
- Satellite Solar Angle (/games/satellite-solar-angle) — Panel orientation in orbit
- Satellite Thermal (/games/satellite-thermal) — Temperature management in space

#### Earth Effects
- Coriolis Effect (/games/coriolis-effect) — Rotating reference frame effects
- Magnus Effect (/games/magnus-effect) — Spinning objects curving through air
- Lift Force (/games/lift-force) — How wings generate upward force

### RF & Communications

#### Antennas
- Antenna Gain (/games/antenna-gain) — Directional signal strength
- Antenna Polarization (/games/antenna-polarization) — Signal orientation matching
- Direction Finding (/games/direction-finding) — Locating signal sources

#### Signal Propagation
- Link Budget (/games/link-budget) — End-to-end signal power calculation
- Fresnel Zones (/games/fresnel-zones) — Radio wave clearance zones
- Fiber Signal Loss (/games/fiber-signal-loss) — Attenuation in optical fiber
- Crosstalk (/games/crosstalk) — Signal coupling between adjacent paths

#### Acoustics
- Echo Time of Flight (/games/echo-time-of-flight) — Measuring distance with sound echoes
- Phone Seismometer (/games/phone-seismometer) — Using phone accelerometers to detect vibrations
- P-Waves S-Waves (/games/p-waves-s-waves) — Compression vs shear seismic waves

### Data Storage

#### Storage Physics
- HDD Physics (/games/h-d-d-physics) — How hard drives read and write magnetically
- Capacitive Touch (/games/capacitive-touch) — How touchscreens detect your finger

### Fun Experiments

#### Kitchen Physics
- Cartesian Diver (/games/cartesian-diver) — Pressure-controlled buoyancy toy
- Bottle Tornado (/games/bottle-tornado) — Creating vortex flow in a bottle
- Soap Boat (/games/soap-boat) — Surface tension propulsion
- Floating Paperclip (/games/floating-paperclip) — Surface tension supporting metal
- Jar Lid Expansion (/games/jar-lid-expansion) — Thermal expansion to the rescue
- Helium Balloon in Car (/games/helium-balloon-car) — Counter-intuitive balloon behavior

#### Optical Illusions
- Wagon Wheel Aliasing (/games/wagon-wheel-aliasing) — Wheels appearing to spin backward
- Rolling Shutter (/games/rolling-shutter) — Distortion from sequential pixel capture
- Moire Patterns (/games/moire-patterns) — Visual interference from overlapping grids

#### Strange Physics
- Chain Fountain (/games/chain-fountain) — Self-siphoning chain phenomenon
- Rattleback (/games/rattleback) — Spin-reversal toy physics
- Stable Levitation (/games/stable-levitation) — Magnetic and acoustic levitation
- Leidenfrost Effect (/games/leidenfrost) — Water droplets dancing on hot surfaces

#### Human Senses
- Reaction Time (/games/reaction-time) — Measure your neural response speed
- Rolling Race (/games/rolling-race) — Predict which shape rolls fastest

---

## Comparison Pages

Head-to-head comparisons of related physics and engineering concepts:

- GPU vs ASIC: Which Hardware Wins for AI Workloads? (/compare/gpu-vs-asic)
- TPU vs GPU: Comparing AI Accelerators for Deep Learning (/compare/tpu-vs-gpu)
- Laminar vs Turbulent Flow: Understanding Flow Regimes (/compare/laminar-vs-turbulent-flow)
- Chiplets vs Monolithic Dies: The Future of Chip Design (/compare/chiplets-vs-monolithic-dies)
- Series vs Parallel Solar Panels: Wiring Configuration Explained (/compare/series-vs-parallel-solar-panels)
- Solar-Grade vs IC-Grade Silicon: Purity Requirements Compared (/compare/solar-grade-vs-ic-grade-silicon)
- Flip Chip vs Wire Bond: Chip Packaging Technologies Compared (/compare/flip-chip-vs-wirebond)
- Static vs Kinetic Friction: Why Starting is Harder Than Sliding (/compare/static-vs-kinetic-friction)
- Rolling vs Sliding: Why Wheels Changed Everything (/compare/rolling-vs-sliding-friction)
- Reflection vs Refraction: How Light Changes Direction (/compare/reflection-vs-refraction)
- Convection vs Conduction: Two Modes of Heat Transfer (/compare/convection-vs-conduction)
- Endothermic vs Exothermic: Reactions That Absorb or Release Heat (/compare/endothermic-vs-exothermic-reactions)
- Elastic vs Inelastic Collisions: Conservation Laws in Action (/compare/elastic-vs-inelastic-collisions)
- Damped vs Forced Oscillations: Decay vs Driven Response (/compare/damped-vs-forced-oscillations)
- Tensor Core vs Systolic Array: NVIDIA vs Google Matrix Hardware (/compare/tensor-core-vs-systolic-array)
- GPU Occupancy vs Memory Bandwidth: Compute vs Memory Bottleneck (/compare/gpu-occupancy-vs-memory-bandwidth)
- Inference Latency vs Batching: Single Request Speed vs Throughput (/compare/inference-latency-vs-batching)
- IV Curve vs Fill Factor: Solar Cell Characterization Methods (/compare/iv-curve-vs-fill-factor)
- MOSFET Switching vs SRAM Cell: Single Transistor vs Memory Cell (/compare/mosfet-vs-sram-cell)
- Leakage Current vs Leakage Power: Individual vs Aggregate Impact (/compare/leakage-current-vs-leakage-power)
- RC Delay vs Interconnect Delay: Simple vs Distributed Model (/compare/rc-delay-vs-interconnect-delay)
- Clock Distribution vs Clock Jitter: Skew vs Noise (/compare/clock-distribution-vs-clock-jitter)
- Network Congestion vs Latency: Throughput vs Response Time (/compare/network-congestion-vs-latency)
- Bypass Diodes vs Shunt/Series Defects: Protection vs Degradation (/compare/bypass-diodes-vs-shunt-defects)
- Solar Temperature Coefficient vs Thermal Derating: Coefficient vs System Impact (/compare/solar-temp-vs-thermal-derating)
- Latent Heat vs Phase Change Energy: Heat Absorbed vs Total Energy (/compare/latent-heat-vs-phase-change-energy)
- Supercooling vs Leidenfrost Effect: Below Freezing vs Above Boiling (/compare/supercooling-vs-leidenfrost)
- Adiabatic Heating vs Newton Cooling: Compression Heating vs Convective Cooling (/compare/adiabatic-heating-vs-newton-cooling)
- Eddy Currents vs Eddy Current Pendulum: Phenomenon vs Demonstration (/compare/eddy-currents-vs-eddy-pendulum)
- Diffraction vs Thin Film Interference: Slit Patterns vs Layer Interference (/compare/diffraction-vs-thin-film)
- Chromatic Aberration vs Depth of Field: Color vs Focus Imperfection (/compare/chromatic-aberration-vs-depth-of-field)
- Memory Hierarchy vs KV Cache: General Memory vs AI-Specific Caching (/compare/memory-hierarchy-vs-kv-cache)
- Photolithography vs Focus-Dose Optimization: Process Overview vs Parameter Tuning (/compare/photolithography-vs-litho-focus-dose)
- Doping Diffusion vs Ion Implantation: Thermal vs Accelerated Doping (/compare/doping-diffusion-vs-ion-implantation)
- Etch Anisotropy vs Deposition Types: Removing vs Adding Material (/compare/etch-anisotropy-vs-deposition-types)
- Static Electricity vs Electric Field: Charge Buildup vs Field Theory (/compare/static-electricity-vs-electric-field)
- Electromagnetic Induction vs Induction Heating: Principle vs Application (/compare/electromagnetic-induction-vs-induction-heating)
- Bifacial Albedo vs Spectral Mismatch: Ground Reflection vs Spectrum Loss (/compare/bifacial-albedo-vs-spectral-mismatch)
- MPPT vs String Sizing: Electrical Optimization vs Physical Configuration (/compare/mppt-vs-string-sizing)
- Convection vs Convection Currents: Mechanism vs Flow Patterns (/compare/convection-vs-convection-currents)
- Ballistic Pendulum vs Inelastic Collisions: Measurement Tool vs Phenomenon (/compare/ballistic-pendulum-vs-inelastic-collisions)
- Karman Vortex Street vs Vortex Rings: 2D Wake vs 3D Rings (/compare/karman-vortex-vs-vortex-rings)
- Beats vs Sound Interference: Temporal vs Spatial Interference (/compare/beats-vs-sound-interference)
- Laser Speckle vs Moire Patterns: Random vs Periodic Interference (/compare/laser-speckle-vs-moire-patterns)
- Polarization vs Polarized Sky: Principle vs Natural Occurrence (/compare/polarization-vs-polarized-sky)
- Standing Waves vs Resonance: Wave Pattern vs Energy Amplification (/compare/standing-waves-vs-resonance)
- Bernoulli Principle vs Venturi Effect: Principle vs Application (/compare/bernoulli-vs-venturi)
- Wireless Charging vs Induction Heating: Power Transfer vs Heating (/compare/wireless-charging-vs-induction-heating)
- Silicon Texturing vs Lithography for Solar: Surface Optimization vs Process Comparison (/compare/texturing-vs-lithography-solar)

## How It Works Pages

Detailed explanations of how physics and engineering concepts work:

- How Does Bernoulli's Principle Work? (/how/bernoullis-principle)
- How Does Buoyancy Work? (/how/buoyancy)
- How Does Capillary Action Work? (/how/capillary-action)
- How Does a Hydraulic Jump Work? (/how/hydraulic-jump)
- How Does the Venturi Effect Work? (/how/venturi-effect)
- How Does the Coriolis Effect Work? (/how/coriolis-effect)
- How Does the Magnus Effect Work? (/how/magnus-effect)
- How Does Orbital Mechanics Work? (/how/orbital-mechanics)
- How Does Electromagnetic Induction Work? (/how/electromagnetic-induction)
- How Do Kirchhoff's Laws Work? (/how/kirchhoffs-laws)
- How Do Eddy Currents Work? (/how/eddy-currents)
- How Does Snell's Law Work? (/how/snells-law)
- How Does the Doppler Effect Work? (/how/doppler-effect)
- How Does Diffraction Work? (/how/diffraction)
- How Does Polarization Work? (/how/polarization)
- How Does Total Internal Reflection Work? (/how/total-internal-reflection)

- How Does the Carnot Cycle Work? (/how/carnot-cycle)
- How Does Thermal Expansion Work? (/how/thermal-expansion)
- How Does the Leidenfrost Effect Work? (/how/leidenfrost-effect)

- How Do Standing Waves Work? (/how/standing-waves)

## Glossary

Definitions of key physics and engineering terms:

- Torque (/glossary/torque) — Rotational equivalent of force, tau = r x F
- Momentum (/glossary/momentum) — Product of mass and velocity, conserved in collisions
- Angular Momentum (/glossary/angular-momentum) — Rotational analog of linear momentum, L = Iw
- Centripetal Force (/glossary/centripetal-force) — Net inward force for circular motion, F = mv^2/r
- Moment of Inertia (/glossary/moment-of-inertia) — Resistance to angular acceleration
- Impulse (/glossary/impulse) — Force times time, equals change in momentum
- Kinetic Energy (/glossary/kinetic-energy) — Energy of motion, KE = 1/2 mv^2
- Potential Energy (/glossary/potential-energy) — Stored energy from position or configuration
- Force (/glossary/force) — Interaction that changes an object's velocity, F = ma
- Work (/glossary/work) — Energy transferred by a force over a displacement
- Power (/glossary/power) — Rate of doing work, measured in watts
- Frequency (/glossary/frequency) — Oscillation cycles per second, measured in hertz
- Wavelength (/glossary/wavelength) — Spatial distance between successive wave peaks
- Amplitude (/glossary/amplitude) — Maximum displacement from equilibrium in a wave
- Period (/glossary/period) — Time for one complete oscillation cycle
- Q Factor (/glossary/q-factor) — Sharpness of resonance in an oscillating system
- Damping Ratio (/glossary/damping-ratio) — Characterizes how oscillations decay over time
- Reynolds Number (/glossary/reynolds-number) — Ratio of inertial to viscous forces, predicts flow regime
- Viscosity (/glossary/viscosity) — Fluid resistance to flow, internal friction
- Surface Tension (/glossary/surface-tension) — Elastic tendency of fluid surfaces to minimize area
- Froude Number (/glossary/froude-number) — Flow inertia vs gravitational effects in open channels
- Contact Angle (/glossary/contact-angle) — Angle where liquid meets solid, indicates wetting
- Specific Heat (/glossary/specific-heat) — Energy to raise 1 kg by 1 degree
- Latent Heat (/glossary/latent-heat) — Energy for phase change without temperature change
- Thermal Conductivity (/glossary/thermal-conductivity) — Material's ability to conduct heat
- Thermal Resistance (/glossary/thermal-resistance) — Opposition to heat flow, analogous to electrical resistance
- Entropy (/glossary/entropy) — Measure of disorder, always increases in isolated systems
- Coefficient of Performance (/glossary/coefficient-of-performance) — Efficiency of heat pumps and refrigerators
- Electric Field (/glossary/electric-field) — Force field around charged particles
- Voltage (/glossary/voltage) — Work done per unit charge, drives current through circuits
- Current (/glossary/current) — Flow of electric charge, measured in amperes
- Resistance (/glossary/resistance) — Opposition to current flow, V = IR
- Impedance (/glossary/impedance) — AC resistance including reactance from capacitors and inductors
- Magnetic Field (/glossary/magnetic-field) — Field produced by moving charges or magnets
- Magnetic Flux (/glossary/magnetic-flux) — Total magnetic field through a surface
- Inductance (/glossary/inductance) — Opposition to changes in current, stores energy in magnetic fields
- Capacitance (/glossary/capacitance) — Ability to store electric charge, C = Q/V
- Refractive Index (/glossary/refractive-index) — Ratio of light speed in vacuum to speed in material
- Focal Length (/glossary/focal-length) — Distance from lens to point where parallel rays converge
- Dispersion (/glossary/dispersion) — Wavelength dependence of phase velocity
- Bandgap (/glossary/bandgap) — Energy gap between valence and conduction bands in semiconductors
- Threshold Voltage (/glossary/threshold-voltage) — Minimum gate voltage to turn on a MOSFET
- Doping (/glossary/doping) — Adding impurities to semiconductors to control conductivity
- Yield (/glossary/yield) — Percentage of functional dies on a semiconductor wafer
- Defect Density (/glossary/defect-density) — Number of killer defects per unit area on a wafer
- Electromigration (/glossary/electromigration) — Metal atom transport causing interconnect failure
- Fill Factor (/glossary/fill-factor) — Solar cell IV curve squareness, measures efficiency
- MPPT (/glossary/mppt) — Maximum Power Point Tracking for solar panels
- Open-Circuit Voltage (/glossary/open-circuit-voltage) — Maximum voltage from a solar cell at zero current
- Irradiance (/glossary/irradiance) — Solar power per unit area, W/m^2
- Tensor Core (/glossary/tensor-core) — NVIDIA GPU unit for fast matrix multiplication
- Systolic Array (/glossary/systolic-array) — TPU-style rhythmic matrix computation
- KV Cache (/glossary/kv-cache) — Key-value storage in transformer attention layers
- Memory Bandwidth (/glossary/memory-bandwidth) — Data transfer rate between processor and memory
- FLOPS (/glossary/flops) — Floating-point operations per second, measures compute throughput
- Quantization (/glossary/quantization) — Reducing numerical precision to shrink AI models
- Arithmetic Intensity (/glossary/arithmetic-intensity) — FLOPS per byte, determines compute vs memory bound
- Ohm's Law (/glossary/ohms-law) — V = IR, foundational relationship for circuits
- Faraday's Law (/glossary/faradays-law) — Changing magnetic flux induces voltage
- Lenz's Law (/glossary/lenzs-law) — Induced current opposes the change that created it
- Snell's Law (/glossary/snells-law) — Relates angles of incidence and refraction
- Critical Angle (/glossary/critical-angle) — Angle above which total internal reflection occurs
- Drag Coefficient (/glossary/drag-coefficient) — Dimensionless drag resistance of an object in fluid
- Buoyant Force (/glossary/buoyant-force) — Upward force from displaced fluid
- Pascal's Law (/glossary/pascals-law) — Pressure transmitted equally in confined fluids
- Newton's Laws (/glossary/newtons-laws) — Three laws of motion forming the foundation of mechanics
- Hooke's Law (/glossary/hookes-law) — Spring force proportional to displacement, F = -kx
- Coulomb's Law (/glossary/coulombs-law) — Force between electric charges, inverse-square law
- Doppler Shift (/glossary/doppler-shift) — Frequency change from relative motion between source and observer
- Diffraction Limit (/glossary/diffraction-limit) — Fundamental resolution limit of optical systems
- Skin Depth (/glossary/skin-depth) — Depth at which AC current drops to 1/e in a conductor
- Carnot Efficiency (/glossary/carnot-efficiency) — Maximum possible heat engine efficiency
- Mach Number (/glossary/mach-number) — Ratio of speed to speed of sound
- Thermal Expansion Coefficient (/glossary/thermal-expansion-coefficient) — How much a material expands per degree
- Emissivity (/glossary/emissivity) — Ratio of thermal radiation to ideal blackbody radiation
- Photovoltaic Effect (/glossary/photovoltaic-effect) — Generating voltage from light in semiconductors
- PUE (/glossary/pue) — Power Usage Effectiveness for data centers
- Delta-V (/glossary/delta-v) — Velocity change needed for orbital maneuvers
- Reactance (/glossary/reactance) — AC opposition from capacitors and inductors
- Angular Velocity (/glossary/angular-velocity) — Rate of rotation in radians per second
- Centripetal Acceleration (/glossary/centripetal-acceleration) — Inward acceleration for circular motion
- Wave Speed (/glossary/wave-speed) — Rate of wave propagation through a medium
- Resonance (/glossary/resonance) — Dramatic amplitude increase at natural frequency
- Back-EMF (/glossary/back-emf) — Voltage generated by spinning motor opposing applied voltage
- Shockley-Queisser Limit (/glossary/shockley-queisser-limit) — Maximum single-junction solar cell efficiency
- Current Density (/glossary/current-density) — Electric current per unit cross-sectional area
- Dielectric Constant (/glossary/dielectric-constant) — Material's ability to store electrical energy in a field
- Albedo (/glossary/albedo) — Fraction of incident light reflected by a surface
- Stress Intensity Factor (/glossary/stress-intensity-factor) — Stress field characterization near a crack tip
- Poisson's Ratio (/glossary/poissons-ratio) — Lateral strain to axial strain ratio when stretched

---

## Topic Pages

Comprehensive topic hubs linking games, comparisons, glossary terms, and how-it-works guides:

- Semiconductor Manufacturing (/topics/semiconductor-manufacturing) — Every step of chip fabrication from lithography to packaging
- Solar Energy & Photovoltaics (/topics/solar-energy) — From photon absorption to grid-tied systems
- Fluid Dynamics (/topics/fluid-dynamics) — Laminar and turbulent flow, pressure, buoyancy, and surface tension
- GPU Architecture & AI Hardware (/topics/gpu-architecture) — GPU internals, memory bandwidth, tensor cores, and power states
- Classical Mechanics (/topics/classical-mechanics) — Newton's laws, forces, momentum, energy, and rotational motion
- Electromagnetic Theory (/topics/electromagnetic-theory) — Electric and magnetic fields, circuits, induction, motors, and shielding
- Optics & Light (/topics/optics-and-light) — Reflection, refraction, diffraction, interference, and polarization
- Thermal Engineering (/topics/thermal-engineering) — Heat transfer, phase changes, gas laws, and cooling systems
- Power Systems & Electronics (/topics/power-systems) — Converters, inverters, grid frequency, batteries, and UPS
- AI Inference & LLM Optimization (/topics/ai-inference) — Latency, throughput, batching, quantization, and the memory wall
- Chip Design & Packaging (/topics/chip-design) — MOSFET to chiplets: transistors, SRAM, clocks, power delivery, and ESD
- Oscillations & Waves (/topics/oscillations-waves) — Pendulums, resonance, sound, standing waves, and vibration damping
- Surface Tension & Capillary Effects (/topics/surface-phenomena) — Capillary action, Marangoni effect, and superhydrophobicity
- Materials Science (/topics/materials-science) — Mechanical properties, corrosion, and molecular behavior
- Space & Orbital Mechanics (/topics/space-orbital) — Satellites, tidal forces, Coriolis and Magnus effects
- RF & Communications (/topics/rf-communications) — Antennas, link budgets, fiber optics, and acoustic sensing
- AI Prompting & Safety (/topics/ai-prompting) — Best practices for prompting LLMs and defending against injection
- Data Center Cooling & Efficiency (/topics/data-center-cooling) — Heat sinks, liquid cooling, PUE, and chiller systems
- Viscosity & Non-Newtonian Fluids (/topics/viscosity-rheology) — Shear thinning, viscoelasticity, and non-Newtonian armor
- Rotational Dynamics (/topics/rotational-dynamics) — Torque, angular momentum, gyroscopes, and rolling motion
- Phase Transitions & Changes (/topics/phase-transitions) — Melting, boiling, supercooling, and the Leidenfrost effect
- ESD & Chip Reliability (/topics/esd-reliability) — Electrostatic discharge, radiation effects, and failure mechanisms
- Interconnects & Signal Integrity (/topics/interconnects-signals) — RC delay, crosstalk, transmission lines, and IR drop
- Fun Physics Experiments (/topics/fun-experiments) — Kitchen physics, optical illusions, and surprising phenomena
- Collisions & Impacts (/topics/collisions-impacts) — Elastic and inelastic collisions, momentum, and impulse
- Network Architecture & Data Movement (/topics/network-architecture) — Congestion, latency, PCIe, and interconnect topologies
- Batteries & Energy Storage (/topics/batteries-energy-storage) — Battery resistance, UPS sizing, and efficiency
- Sound & Acoustics (/topics/sound-acoustics) — Beats, interference, reverberation, and the Doppler effect
- Chemical Reactions & Energy (/topics/chemical-reactions-energy) — Endothermic, exothermic reactions, and Arrhenius kinetics

---

Coach Atlas is free to use. No account required. Works on any device with a modern web browser.
